sense.name: material or tangible substance
sense.examples: The theory conjectures that tiny strings are the most basic stuff of the universe, out of which everything else is made. The sticky stuff on the countertop was hard to clean up. Wheat is the stuff they use to make bread out of.

sense.name: collection of miscellaneous artifacts or possessions
sense.examples: This antique shop has some really interesting old stuff. The old tenant left a lot of his stuff in the apartment when he left. What do you want to do with all the stuff on the porch?

sense.name: information content via discourse
sense.examples: Don't listen to that stuff - it's total nonsense! A lot of boring stuff goes on in the middle of the movie, but the climax is exciting. His lecture was all stuff we'd heard before. Don't give me that stuff! (say those things)

sense.name: a fundamental constituent or characteristic of something
sense.examples: His rags-to-riches Hollywood success is the stuff of dreams. The average worker was made of more resilient stuff than politicians imagined. Suspense is the very stuff of narrative.

sense.name: personal knowledge and skill
sense.commentary: STUFF[+quality][+skill][+knowledgeable][+personal] Note: uses with self-reference to the subject.
sense.examples: When it comes to molecular biology, John really knows his stuff. The young pitcher assumed the mound and showed his stuff to a sequence of batters. The actress really strutted her stuff in the final act of the play. He has the stuff to be an Olympic athlete.
